title: CSM university Archive (Jonas Kortens, Incunabula and Old books - 1743)
content:
This is a book from the Central Saint Martins Archive. As i say in the title it is a book by Jonas Kortens. Titled Incunabula and Old books and was printed in 1743.

The current archive lecturer didn't know much about this book other then the details i have given here. Despite its poor condition its really beautiful and really worth a look. If anybody can translate any of the content that would be much appreciated or any information at all about the blackletter type would also be helpful.

If not just enjoy these images of a beautiful old book. (more images here [http://www.flickr.com/photos/iiwekei/sets/72157622880237506/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131040904/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/iiwekei/sets/72157622880237506/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/iiwekei/sets/72157622880237506/"))

Peter Ainsworth

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131040904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/4136156176_a3f796f218_4367.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131040904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/4135395375_f79c250e17_6702.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131040904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/4136154954_07ba94775c_4556.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131040904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/4135394345_f14c161886_3874.jpg)
author: Peter Ainsworth

comments.content:
This is a description of a travel to the Holy Land and its neighbors.  
And this is a rouhg line by line translation of the tilepage:

Jonas Kortens'  
Former bookseller at Altona (= now part of Hamburg, Germany)  
Travel  
To the former  
Holy  
But now  
For seventeen hundred years  
Under the curse lying  
Land  
Also to Egypt, Mount Lebanon  
Syria and Mesopotamia  
Written as seen by himself  
And  
In this second Edition  
With two supplements  
Augmented  
Published by the author  
Halle  
Printed by Joh. Christian Grunert, 1743

Thanks. If anyone can help on any of the other images (any information) i am still looking for a bit more knowledge about the book. Its quite interesting to draw comparisons with dexter sinister. Re-publishing out of print material just as this Incunabula is.
